etymology.description: Phonetic: 公(公) (gōng, "duke") + Semantic: 羽(羽) (yǔ, "wings") -> Originally "feathers" -> Loaned to mean "old man" through association with 公
etymology.interpretation: The character 翁(wēng, "old man") originally depicted something related to feathers or birds, with 公(公) contributing sound. Over time, as 公 also connoted a certain status or respect, the term was borrowed to respectfully refer to an elder or 'old man'.

examples.chinese: 庭院中坐着一位翁(庭院中坐著一位翁)，目光远眺(目光遠眺)。
examples.pinyin: Tíngyuàn zhōng zuòzhe yī wèi wēng, mùguāng yuǎntiào.
examples.english: An old man sits in the courtyard and gazes into the distance.

examples.chinese: 街角那位白发翁(街角那位白髮翁)，总是微笑(總是微笑)。
examples.pinyin: Jiējiǎo nà wèi báifà wēng, zǒngshì wēixiào.
examples.english: The old man with white hair on the corner always smiles.

examples.chinese: 老翁的故事(老翁的故事)，在村里流传(在村裡流傳)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo wēng de gùshì, zài cūn lǐ liúchuán.
examples.english: The old man's story is passed down in the village.
